name: thermal energy storage construction, for adiabatic compressed air energy storage | thermal energy storage, for adiabatic compressed air energy storage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25071/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of a thermal energy storage for adiabatic compressed air energy storage (ACAES). This ACAES is based on using electricity to compress air and store it in underground caverns or porous rock formation. The air is released when needed and passed through a turbine to generate electricity. The ACAES consists of an underground air storage, compressors, expanders, heat exchange units and  thermal energy storage (TES). The TES stores heat generating during compression which is then used for preheating of the airflow before expansion is done. The thermal energy storage consists of two separate thermal cycles, with each cycle being connected to a compressor and an expander (which are not included). The heat generated during air compression is stored in a thermal mass with a specific heat of 3.33 kJ/(kg*K) consisting of a thermal mineral oil. Storage tanks in the system act as buffer for the thermal mass. The size of the storage tanks and necessary amount of thermal mass is determined by the target system requirements for storage, i.e. 19.2 GWh electrical which leads to a thermal mass of 4.8*E+07 kg thermal mineral oil. The lifetime is assumed to be 100 a. The material requirement for the thermal energy storage systems is based on an analysis for thermal energy storage for a solar power plant presented by Nandi et al., Analysis of high temperature thermal energy storage for solar power plant. In: IEEE ICESET 2012; https://doi.org/10.1109/ICSET.2012.6357438 and adapted by Bouman, Evert A.; Øberg, Martha M.; Hertwich, Edgar G. (2016): Environmental impacts of balancing offshore wind power with compressed air energy storage (CAES). In: Energy 95, S. 91–98. DOI: 10.1016/j.energy.2015.11.041;;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - thermal energy storage construction, for adiabatic compressed air energy storage, GLO, 2015 - 2015 (cefa6969-deaf-43fd-a59a-614400eb2787)]

This activity starts with the receival of materials at the construciton site. On-site energy demand or emissions are not included. Land use is considered in the ACAES dataset.

The activity ends with the dismantling of the thermal energy storage.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period in correspondance to underlying literature source.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The thermal energy storage consists of two separate thermal cycles, with each cycle being connected to a compressor and an expander. The heat generated during air compression is stored in a thermal mass with a specific heat of 3.33 kJ/(kg*K) consisting of a thermal mineral oil. Storage tanks in the system act as buffer for the thermal mass. Mass of thermal oil: 4.8E+07 kg
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The inventory is completely based on Bouman et al. (2016) who refer to Nandi et al. (2012). The data were originally sampled for a solar thermal power plant and adapted by Bouman et al.
